quinaryItem.heading: Let’s get creative together
quinaryItem.paragraph: Your message can be told by big agency talent who work and live where you do. Kernel delivers a suite of cost-effective creative services for any size business.

data.heading: What are the NBA Playoffs
data.paragraph: The National Basketball Association (NBA) playoffs are a best-of-seven elimination tournament among 16 teams in the Eastern Conference and Western Conference (called divisions, pre-1970), ultimately deciding the league's season champion in the NBA Finals.

data.heading: How to grow your brand with Kernel’s creative services

items.heading: Concept
items.paragraph: Access to the right screens, the right shows, and the most advanced advertising products is crucial in engaging customers who are ready to buy.

items.heading: Design
items.paragraph: Whoever helps you build your brand should be local, personable and fully committed to your success.

items.heading: Post Production
items.paragraph: The time, money and energy put into a campaign will mean nothing without rich data to evaluate your investment and inform your next move.

data.heading: Learn more about who's watching the NBA Playoffs
data.paragraph: Nearly 90% of the NBA Playoffs leading up to the NBA Finals are on Cable, not including ESPN Deportes, which airs the Finals in Spanish. The Finals begin 6/1 and run through 6/18.

With the majority of consumers using multiple devices throughout the day, it’s never been more essential to have a multi-screen advertising strategy. When combined, TV and Digital work together to make your ads more memorable, even doubling your message recall when the same ad runs on both TV and online.
data.heading: The New Media Landscape
Glossary of advertising terms
data.paragraph: Unlock the language required to gain full control of your advertising.

items.label: Availability (”avails”)
items.value: Unsold units of time available for broadcasters to sell to advertisers. Also refers to a station’s submission of programs and rating estimates for advertising planning and buying.

items.label: Bonus Spot
items.value: additional TV or radio spot provided to an advertiser at no charge to raise the overall audience delivery of the schedule.

items.label: Advertising impression
items.value: the audience delivery of media vehicles, programs or schedules. Usually expressed as thousands (000).

items.label: Adjacency
items.value: an advertising pod positioned next to a particular TV or radio program. Also called commercial break positions.

items.label: Availability (“avails”)
items.value: unsold units of time available for broadcasters to sell to advertisers. Also refers to a station’s submission of programs and rating estimates for advertising planning and buying.

items.label: Average Quarter-Hour Rating
items.value: the audience estimate reported by Nielsen and Arbitron for television and radio. It provides the average number of persons or households who watched/listened for at least 5 minutes of the 15 minute segment being reported.

items.label: Bonus Spot
items.value: additional TV or radio spot provided to an advertiser at no charge to raise the overall audience delivery of the schedule.
